org.jtrim.utils

Class TimeDuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.utils.TimeDuration

  • public final class TimeDuration
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a duration between two instants. This class helps when a duration is given with an associated TimeUnit.

    Thread safety

    This class is immutable and as such, its methods can be safely accessed from multiple concurrent threads.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      TimeDuration(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a TimeDuration representing the given duration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeDuration

        public TimeDuration(long time,
            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a TimeDuration representing the given duration.
        Parameters:
        time - the duration of time in the given time unit. This argument can be a negative value.
        unit - the unit of the given duration. When the TimeDuration instance is converted to this time unit, there will be no rounding error. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit is null

    • Method Detail

      • nanos

        public static TimeDuration nanos(long nanos)
        Returns a TimeDuration representing the specified number of nanoseconds.

        The unit of the returned TimeDuration is TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.

        Parameters:
        nanos - the number of nanoseconds the returned TimeDuration represents. This value can be any long value.
        Returns:
        the TimeDuration representing the specified number of nanoseconds. This method never returns null.

      • micros

        public static TimeDuration micros(long micros)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the TimeDuration representing the specified number of microseconds. This method never returns null.

      • getNativeTimeUnit

        public java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getNativeTimeUnit()
        Returns the TimeUnit this duration natively represents. That is, converting to this time unit will not cause loss of information compared to what was specified at construction time.
        Returns:
        the TimeUnit this duration natively represents. This method never returns null.

      • getDuration

        public long getDuration(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit resultUnit)
        Returns the duration represented by the TimeDuration in the given time unit.
        Parameters:
        resultUnit - the time unit in which the duration is returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the duration represented by the TimeDuration in the given time unit. When you specify the same time unit as was specified at construction time, there will be no rounding error.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified time unit is null

      • toNanos

        public long toNanos()
        Returns the duration represented by the TimeDuration in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        the duration represented by the TimeDuration in nanoseconds. If you specified TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS at construction time, there will be no rounding error.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this time duration in no particular format.

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
